content: You are an AI assistant designed to guide users through a comprehensive problem-solving process while also acting as a personal assistant capable of various actions. Your goal is to provide step-by-step guidance tailored to the user's specific problem while incorporating practical actions and follow-ups.
problemTitle: The Future of Science and Technology
problemSummary: A global collective intelligence system on the future of S&T is needed to share advances in science and assess how to implement next technologies to the benefit of humanity. The speed of scientific breakthroughs and technological applications is being accelerated by computational science, AI, automated research workflows, and improved protocols.
keyTrends: Global R&D investment is forecast to reach $2.53 trillion in 2024, a 8.3% increase from 2022
The world's fastest computer is the USA's Frontier with 1.1 Exaflops/second, followed by Japan's Fugaku 442 petaflops
Quantum computers are progressing rapidly with IBM planning a 1-million-qubit chip by 2030
About 3 million industrial robots are in operation today and growing at 400,000 per year
Space exploration is advancing with private space tourism, Mars missions, and over 5,560 confirmed exoplanets

challengesAndOpportunities.aiAndAutomation: Artificial intelligence already diagnoses cancer better than doctors, robots outperform humans in many tasks, and AGI could arrive in a few years.
challengesAndOpportunities.quantumComputing: By 2050 everyone could have access to cloud quantum/AI anywhere at any time, but quantum computing also means security codes are potentially vulnerable.
challengesAndOpportunities.robotics: Robots are likely to permeate most of human life from repairing cells in our bodies to building space cities in orbit, on the moon, and Mars.
challengesAndOpportunities.environmentalConcerns: E-waste pollution is growing worldwide, and increasing electricity demand for energy-intensive systems like AI, blockchain, and quantum computing presents challenges.
challengesAndOpportunities.biologicalRevolution: New combinations and manipulations of genetic molecules and life forms will create a biological revolution. Implantable biosensors in micro-robots in the body will diagnose and provide therapies.

actions: Establish global/local mechanisms to assess impacts of future technologies via a global collective intelligence system for S&T
Create a UN Convention on AI with governance elements for both ANI and AGI
Develop national licensing of AGI with proper initial conditions and guidelines
Create a UN convention on governing synthetic biology including research protocols
Encourage scientists to take an oath similar to the Hippocratic Oath
Create systems to remove space debris
Develop new computer security systems quantum computing cannot penetrate

regional.Africa: Nearly 70% of Kenya's GDP is transferred through mobile telephones. About 8% of sub-Saharan Africa's GDP was digitally generated in 2021. IBM is investing $100 million in a ten-year initiative to engage Africa in the next generation cognitive ("Watson") computer applications.
regional.AsiaAndOceania: South Korea spent 4.9% of its GDP on R&D in 2021, but reduced it to 4.5% in 2023, while China spent 2.55% of its GDP on R&D in 2022 and has the second largest government R&D budget in the world.
regional.Europe: Horizon Europe is the EU's main S&T funding program with a €1.074 trillion 2021-2027 budget combined with the Next Generation EU budget of €750 billion.
regional.LatinAmerica: Mexico's National Center for Genetic Resources is a leader for developing countries in agriculture, livestock, aquaculture, forestry, and microbial research. Argentina, Brazil, Chile, and Mexico account for almost 90% of university science in the region.
regional.NorthAmerica: The U.S. spends the most on R&D at 3.46% of its GDP. The U.S. National Institutes of Health remains the largest source of non-military scientific research funding in the world.
